Vitesse 43241 Citroën Xsara WRC 2009 Cyprus Rally 2rd Place P. Solberg/P. Mills (#20 of 1499)

Purchased: 2010
Manufacturer page: http://www.sunstarmodelcars.com/43241/43241.htm

(from Wikipedia)
After Subaru's withdrawal from the WRC in late 2008, Solberg officially unveiled the Petter Solberg World Rally Team in early 2009, with himself as driver and Phil Mills as co-driver. It took some time to adapt to the new car during their first round in Norway, but eventually Petter and Phil managed to secure a sixth place and three points in the drivers' championship. Following that result and a new engine from Citroën, Solberg finished third in the Cyprus Rally, being the first true privateer in a privately run team to be in the podium since Malcolm Wilson back in 1993.

The model is what you would expect from Vitesse. This is looks a little worse than the average Vitesse since it broke free from the base during shipping causing some damage to decals. The bonnet opens which, IMO, is a complete waste of time. Fortunately the livery helps camouflage the huge gaps around the bonnet.
